thread.title: Don Cherry defends Blue Jays in epic twitter rant | Baseball | Sports | Toronto
thread.title_full: Don Cherry defends Blue Jays in epic twitter rant | Baseball | Sports | Toronto

author: Postmedia Network
title: Don Cherry defends Blue Jays in epic twitter rant | Baseball | Sports | Toronto
text:
Don Cherry is not happy about how the Blue Jays went out.
Taking to Twitter, Cherry ripped into calls made in Game 6 of the ALCS, in which the Blue Jays' World Series dreams were crushed by a 4-3 defeat at the hands of the Kansas City Royals.
"We got stiffed! Bad calls is one of the biggest reasons we lost," Cherry wrote in his 10-part rant.
"Why? Because a Canadian team in the World Series would be a TV disaster in the States."
Cherry, who has voiced his belief that the MLB doesn't want the sole Canadian team in the World Series before, highlighted a strike out call made on Jays' left fielder Ben Revere in the 9th.
While the team hadn't necessarily been hitting well throughout the series, the controversial call sparked some heavy debate - and sent an awestruck Revere to take his anger out on a trash can in the team's dugout.
According to pitching charts , Revere and Cherry have reason to be upset about the call that left Revere in a 2-2 hole against Royals pitcher Wade Davis instead of giving him the 3-1 advantage.
Despite his frustration, Cherry ended on a positive note, praising Blue Jays pitcher David Price for his efforts during the game.
1) I know the Blue Jays are reading the papers and listening and watching TV back here in Toronto, coming home and saying “What, they don’t
— Don Cherry (@CoachsCornerCBC) October 24, 2015 2) know we got stiffed?” Even the American announcers said during the game when there was an obvious balk “that is an obvious balk,” it
— Don Cherry (@CoachsCornerCBC) October 24, 2015 3) wasn't called. When the homerun came, they said that was an automatic double, they said it, the American announcers, but no, it was a
— Don Cherry (@CoachsCornerCBC) October 24, 2015 4) homerun. Revere, bases loaded, a called strike when the count was 2-1 which made it 2-2. Now Revere has to protect the plate, instead if
— Don Cherry (@CoachsCornerCBC) October 24, 2015 5) it was 3-1 which it should have been, the pitcher has to give Revere something to hit, or walk in the winning run. The American
— Don Cherry (@CoachsCornerCBC) October 24, 2015 6) announcers said it was a ball instead the umpires called it a strike. It was around Revere’s shoulders. We got stiffed! Bad calls,
— Don Cherry (@CoachsCornerCBC) October 24, 2015 7) is one of the biggest reasons we lost. That call on Revere is why he was smashing the garbage can after striking out. Why are Canadians
— Don Cherry (@CoachsCornerCBC) October 24, 2015 8) so gutless to say it like it is? I know the Blue Jays read my tweets. I will say it for you, You got stiffed! Why? Because a Canadian
— Don Cherry (@CoachsCornerCBC) October 24, 2015 9) team in the World Series would be a TV disaster in the States. Blue Jays you can’t beat Kansas City and the umpires too. I knew when the
— Don Cherry (@CoachsCornerCBC) October 24, 2015 10) set up guy Cecil got hurt, it through the whole pitching off. Price you were great. Stick around next year. We need you!
— Don Cherry (@CoachsCornerCBC) October 24, 2015 Sponsored Links See All Sponsored Links
